result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Petar Zoric

defendant.name: Zoric, Petar

records.addlTxt:
8:58 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. 
Defendant Petar Zoric in court.  Attorney McMurray for attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Petar Zoric. 
Defense requests more time along with discovery and an offer. 
State will forward discovery.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

1:59 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.  Defendant Petar Zoric in court. 
Defendant does not have counsel at this time but has contacted counsel.  
Defendant requests a new date. 
Court will set a new date for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

10:13 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Petar Zoric in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion and order to seal victim impact statements
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
